entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest goblins love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kobolds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 120 years but rarely do so.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kobolds are fundamentally selfish, making them evil, but their reliance on the strength of their group makes them trend toward law.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kobolds are between 2 and 3 feet tall and weigh between 25 and 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Grovel, Cower, and Beg
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Loxodons physically mature at the same rate as humans, but they live about 450 years. They highly value the weight of wisdom and experience and are considered young until they reach the age of 60.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most loxodons are lawful, believing in the value of a peaceful, ordered life. They also tend toward good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Loxodons stand between 7 and 8 feet tall. Their massive bodies weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Large.

entries.name: Loxodon Serenity
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Tip: AC Calculations Don't Stack
entries: When the game gives you more than one way to calculate your Armor Class, you can use only one of them. You choose the one to use. For example, if you have the loxodon's Natural Armor trait and the monk's Unarmored Defense feature, you don't mix them together. Instead, you choose which one determines your AC.

entries.name: Trunk
entries: You can grasp things with your trunk, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options.
Your trunk can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Thanks to your sensitive trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Loxodon.

entries.name: Age
entries: Shardminds were created fully mature, and do not physically age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Shardminds are fragments of pure thought given life and substance. They are logical, emotionally distant, and naive to the ways of society in the world. The Shardmind race has spent thousands of years tending gardens of living crystal. Due to this, they are familiar with order and routine and have a strong lawful bent. They are scarcely evil and are usually good or neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Shardminds are crystalline creatures consisting of hundreds of small shards of translucent green, white, red, or amber crystal assembled into humanoid form and animated by a force of pure psionic energy. Shardminds range from small crystalline buds, mere 3 feet in height, to large geode-like behemoths, well over 7 feet. Their hard crystalline body makes them much heavier than humans, at around 180 to 230 pounds. Your size is Small, Medium or Large.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to chaotic thunder and dazzling arrays of colour of the Astral Plane, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. Your darkvision is special though, as you can't discern color in darkness, and everything is in a pinkish hue.

entries.name: Crystalline Mind
entries: You can communicate mentally with another creature that knows the same language you do within a 60-foot radius. This creature needs to share a language with you, and unless they have telepathy themselves they can only receive and respond but can't initiate or terminate a telepathic conversation. You must be conscious to use this trait and while you can telepathically communicate with multiple creatures at once, conversing telepathically with multiple creatures simultaneously is just as difficult as listening to multiple people speak. In addition, you have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Crystalline Body
entries: Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature. You are immune to diseases. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish.

entries.name: Arcane Psionics
entries: Because you came from The Living Gate, arcane energy courses through your body. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

In addition, you know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell detect magic spell} once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial, but can speak only using your Crystalline Mind feature. Additionally, you understand Shardspeak, a strange language made up of deep, resonating humming only communicated by telepaths, and very few beings other than the Shardminds themselves know it. It uses the Primordial script.

entries.name: Age
entries: As Wilden age, their bodies move through the seasons. Young Wilden are like trees in spring, filled with life and vigor—their bodies a green hue. In the Summer phase, a Wilden's body is brown or tan, while the cloak of leaves remain vibrant green. Wilden in the autumn phase undergo a profound change, their skin darkening as their leaves turn color to reds, yellows, and oranges. Finally, the winter phase heralds the end of a Wilden's life, as the body grows thinner and the Wilden's leaves wither and fall. A typical Wilden lives more than a century; just over 100 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: As a protector of nature, Wilden tend to lean towards neutral. Wilden also tend to be good in nature, due to their relative naivety and love of the wild.

entries.name: Size
entries: Wilden range from just under 5 feet to just over 6 feet. Their plant-like body makes them lighter than humans, at around 100 to 140 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Your are a Fey, which means you count as Fey for the purposes of determining spells and effects that affect Fey.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests of the Feywild, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Nature's Aspect
entries: {@i Choose your Wilden's Aspect: Ancients, Destroyer or Hunter. When finishing a long rest, any Wilden can change their Aspect. See the "Info" tab for more information.}

entries.name: Aspect of The Ancients
items: While embodying the Aspect of the Ancients, you gain the following benefits:

{@b Fey Magic}. You know the {@spell Druidcraft} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Spike Growth} spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Misty Step} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Knowledge of The Ancients}. You gain proficiency with the {@item Quarterstaff|PHB}, {@item Scimitar|PHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|PHB}, and {@item Longbow|PHB}.

{@b Voyage of The Ancients}. When you reach 3rd level, you gain the power of this Aspect. Immediately after you hit a creature, you can teleport up to 15 feet away. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Aspect of the Destroyer
items: While embodying the Aspect of the Destroyer, you gain the following benefits:
{@b Savage Attacks}. When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon’s damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
{@b Destroyer Weapon Honing}. You gain proficiency with the {@item Battleaxe|PHB}, {@item Quarterstaff|PHB}, {@item Shortbow|PHB}, and {@item Longbow|PHB}.

{@b Wrath of the Destroyer}. When you reach 3rd level, you gain the power of this Aspect. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to make one attack against that creature. If your attack hits, the enemy must succeed on a constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier) or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once you hit with this attack you cannot use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Aspect of the Hunter
items: While embodying the Aspect of the Hunter, you gain the following benefits:

{@b Language of The Tree-jumper}. You can communicate with beasts and plants. You also have advantage on Charisma checks to influence them. These creatures can understand the meaning of your words, even though you cannot understand them in return.
{@b Hunter Martial Gifts}. You gain proficiency with the {@item Spear|PHB}, {@item Scimitar|PHB}, {@item Shortbow|PHB}, and {@item Longbow|PHB}.

{@b Pursuit of the Hunter}. Whenever a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from you, if you hit that creature, you can choose to learn the following traits about the enemy: Its Armor Class, its maximum hit points, one of its resistances and one of its saving throw bonuses. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: One with Stone
entries: Climbing stone surfaces doesn't cost you extra movement

entries.name: Binding Clay
entries: You can cast the {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE} spell once with this trait, requiring no material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: One with The Veil
entries: You can detect the faint shifts in clouds and darkened vapors; lightly obscuring fog and smoke do not impose disadvantage on Wisom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight.
In addition, while heaviliy obscured by fog or smoke, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Spark and Smoke
entries: You know the {@spell create bonfire|XGE} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell once with this trait as a 1st-level spell, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Frost Walk
entries: You can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without expending extra movement. While crossing bodies of water, you can freeze a thin layer of water below the soles of your feet, and walk across the surface of water as if on solid ground. The thin ice sheets beneath your soles melt as soon as you lift your feet, and you cannot be carrying anything heavier than your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Command Over Ice
entries: You know the {@spell frostbite} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|XGE} spell once with this trait as a 1st-level spell, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Molten Shell
entries: After you finish a long rest, you gain a layer of protective rock, providing temporary hit points equal to twice your Constitution modifier. When an enemy deals damage to the layer with a melee attack, they take {@dice 1d6} fire damage. If you choose to gain temporary hit points from any other source, thsi feature is immediately lost. The layer cannot be replenished by any means, except by taking a long rest.

entries.name: Searing Combustion
entries: You know the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell pyrotechnics|XGE} spell once with this trait as a 1st-level spell, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

spell.name: Accelerated Deceleration

m.text: a small stone statuette of a whale

entries: This spell is used by apprentice chronurgists to hone their time-manipulating powers. You can create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: You can create a small magical wonder, such as growing a flower in a spot where flowers don't grow, causing small snowflakes to fall to the ground around you, or even make a summer breeze pass under a creatures feet. The extent of these effects are up to you, at the DM's discretion.
You can spoil or freshen one piece of food no larger than 1 cubic foot you can see within range. This doesn't work on food which has been spoiled for over a week.

You can suspend one object weighing no more than 10 lbs up to 10 feet into the air. Any pressure or weight put on it will immediately make it fall back down to the ground. While it is suspended in this way, it slightly oscelates and rotates in place, giving off a faint celestial noise.
You can immediately learn the precise time of day to the nearest minute, including the current hour, day, month, and year.

You can accelerate or decelerate time centered on a point within range. Anything within 1 cubic foot of the point you chose is affected by this effect. Examples of this effect include bringing a cauldron of water to a boil in seconds or causing a clock to speed up or down to show to wrong time. The extent of these effects are up to you, at the DM's discretion.
You can turn back time on a small fire, such as a candle, torch or small campfire, lighting or snuffing it out instantly.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Alinaar's Amazing Altering

m.text: A small pile of ash, a diamond worth at least 200 gp and a broken horn

entries: This spell transforms you or a creature you touch into a new form. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or die. The new form can be any beast, dragon, elemental, giant, monstrosity, ooze, or plant whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your current level. Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature. You retain your alignment and personality.

You assume the hit points of your new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious. You are limited in the actions you can perform by nature of your new form, and you can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech unless your new form is naturally capable of doing so.

If the new form doesn't wield equipment then your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment. If the new form is one that normally wields equipment then your gear transforms into the new form's standard equipment, as determined by the DM.

spell.name: Ana's Aiding Aura
entries: Healing power radiates from you in an aura with a 5-foot radius, soothing pain in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. While in the aura, all allies in the aura (including you) heal {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier whenever they start their turn in the aura or move through it's space on their turn.

spell.name: Armor of Phlegethos
entries: A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as spectral flames that wreathe and flicker around you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the fire damage increase by 5 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Avandra's Mischief

components.m: a piece of crust from an apple pie

entries: You fill a 20-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range with fey and draconic magic. Roll on the Mischievous Surge table to determine the magical effect produced. At the start of each of your turns, you can move the cube up to 10 feet and reroll on the table.

entries.caption: Mischievous Surge
rows: The smell of apple pie fills the air, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you until the start of your next turn.

Bouquets of flowers appear all around, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn as the flowers spray water in their faces.

Each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or begin giggling until the start of your next turn. A giggling creature is {@condition incapacitated} and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.
Drops of molasses appear and hover in the cube, turning it into difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Draconic Transformation

m.text: a statuette of a dragon, worth at least 500 gp

entries: With a roar, you draw on the magic of dragons to transform yourself, taking on various draconic features. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're {@condition blinded} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an {@condition invisible} creature, unless the creature successfully hides from you.
Incorporeal wings sprout from your back, giving you a flying speed of 40 feet.

When you cast this spell, and as a bonus action on subsequent turns for the duration, you can exhale a breath of shimmering energy in a 30- foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Bahamut's Platinum Shield

m.text: a platinum-plated dragon scale, worth at least 500 gp

entries: You create a field of silvery light that surrounds a creature of your choice within range (you can choose yourself). The field sheds dim light out to 5 feet.
As a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can move the field to another creature within 60 feet of the field.
The creature protected by the field gains the following benefits:

items: The creature has half cover.
The creature has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage.

If the creature is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the creature instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

spell.name: Flame Stride
entries: The billowing flames of a dragon cover your feet, granting you explosive speed. For the duration, your speed increases by 20 feet and moving doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

When you move within 5 feet of a creature or object that isn't being worn or carried, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage from your trail of heat. A creature or object can take this damage only once during a turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase your speed by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 3rd. Additionally, the spell deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gallen's Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. The spirit looks like a transparent beast or fey (your choice).

Until the spell ends, whenever you or a creature you can see moves into the spirit's space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can cause the spirit to restore {@dice 1d6} hit points to that creature (no action required). The spirit can't heal constructs or undead.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 1d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hallaster's Tower

components.m: a fragment of stone, wood, or other building material

entries: You conjure a two-story tower made of stone, wood, or similar suitably sturdy materials. The tower can be round or square in shape. Each level of the tower is 10 feet tall and has an area of up to 100 square feet. Access between levels consists of a simple ladder and hatch. Each level takes one of the following forms, chosen by you when you cast the spell:

items: A bedroom with a bed, chairs, chest, and magical fireplace
A study with desks, books, bookshelves, parchments, ink, and ink pens
A dining space with a table, chairs, magical fireplace, containers, and cooking utensils
A lounge with couches, armchairs, side tables and footstools
A washroom with toilets, washtubs, a magical brazier, and sauna benches
An observatory with a telescope and maps of the night sky
An unfurnished, empty room

entries: The interior of the tower is warm and dry, regardless of conditions outside. Any equipment or furnishings conjured with the tower dissipate into smoke if removed from it. At the end of the spell's duration, all creatures and objects within the tower that were not created by the spell appear safely outside on the ground, and all traces of the tower and its furnishings disappear.

You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the tower's existence for another 24 hours. You can create a permanent tower by casting this spell in the same location and with the same configuration every day for one year.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the tower can have one additional story for each slot level beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Laiquaril's Frost
entries: A burst of icy cold energy emanates from you in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage and is covered in ice for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to break the ice off itself or another creature. A creature covered in ice has its speed reduced to 0. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the cold damage by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Lily's Vault of Amber
entries: You arrange 5 small amber gems in a loose circle around any non-living materials and trace Transmutative sigils above each of them. All materials within the circle are pulled into the largest of the gems and stored there, in stasis. The contents do not age, weather, or rot. The gem can hold up to 500 lbs of material.
After you've cast this spell, you can use an action to speak a single, chosen word and release the gem's contents onto the ground. Contents are also released if dispelled.

spell.name: Magefire
entries: You instantly cause a small harmless colored flame to appear in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The effect looks like a regular flame, but it creates no heat and doesn't use oxygen. Magefire can be covered or hidden but not smothered or quenched. The flames' color and light can be colored as you like, and the flame gives off dim light in a 5-foot radius.
The duration of this spell is one day or until dispelled. In addition, you can have multiple flames active at the same time, up to a maximum of 3.

The amount of flames you can have active at once, as well as the spell's duration, increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the duration increases by one day (for a total of 2 days), and the amount of flames you can have active increase to 5. Both of these numbers increase by 2 at 11th level (5 days & 8 flames), and at 17th level the duration increases to 1 week and the amount of flames you can have active at once becomes unlimited.

spell.name: Matthias' Protective Dome
entries: You create a magical 60-foot-radius dome of force energy around you that moves with you. No creature, object, spell, gaze, or breath weapon can enter the dome unless you allow it.

Any creature hostile to you inside the dome when you cast this spell must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 12d8} force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. The creature must also succeed on a Strength saving throw, or, unless it is willing, be jettisoned outside the dome to the nearest unnocupied space next to the dome. If a creature succeeds on the strength saving throw, it takes {@dice 5d6} force damage each round while in still in the dome.
The dome can be destroyed with enough effort. The dome has 100 hit points and is resistant to fire and cold damage, and is immune to poison damage. An antimagic field has no effect on the dome.

spell.name: Qo's Thunderous Roar
entries: You let out a magically amplified dragon-like roar. Each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 3d12} thunder damage and is pushed 15 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 15 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a draconic boom audible out to 500 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|3,5,7,9|1d8} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Laiquaril's Psychic Lance
entries: You unleash a shimmering lance of psychic power from your forehead at a creature that you can see within range. Alternatively, you can utter the creature's name. If the named target is within range, it gains no benefit from cover or invisibility as the lance homes in on it. If the named target isn't within range, the lance dissipates, and the spell slot is not expended.
The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 10d6} psychic damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Rhoderihck's Speedy Courier

m.text: 25 gp, or mineral goods of equivalent value, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon a Small fire elemental to a spot within range. The fire elemental is formless, nearly transparent, immune to all damage, and cannot interact with other creatures or objects. It carries an open, empty chest whose interior dimensions are 3 feet on each side. While the spell lasts, you can deposit as many items inside the chest as will fit. You can then name a living creature you have met and seen at least once before, or any creature for which you possess a body part, lock of hair, clipping from a nail, or similar portion of the creature's body.

As soon as the lid of the chest is closed, the elemental and the chest disappear, then reappear adjacent to the target creature. If the target creature is on another plane, or if it is proofed against magical detection or location, the contents of the chest reappear on the ground at your feet.

The target creature is made aware of the chest's contents before it chooses whether or not to open it, and knows how much of the spell's duration remains in which it can retrieve them. No other creature can open the chest and retrieve its contents. When the spell expires or when all the contents of the chest have been removed, the elemental and the chest disappear. The elemental also disappears if the target creature orders it to return the items to you. When the elemental disappears, any items not taken from the chest reappear on the ground at your feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using an 8th-level spell slot, you can send the chest to a creature on a different plane of existence from you.

spell.name: Rhoderihck's Web of Fire

m.text: a knitting resembling a fireball or string coated in phosphorus

entries: Striking both palms down upon the ground, a web of flame crackles out around you and five streaks of fire rapidly snake along the ground toward up to five enemies that you can see within range, leaping towards their target and exploding into a column of flame upon reaching them. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Alternatively, all five streaks of fire can instead converge toward a single target, dealing {@dice 12d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire can travel over obstacles up to 5 feet high, and ignites flammable objects along its path that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 8d6|4-9|1d6} (8d6) or {@scaledice 12d6|4-9|1d6} (12d6) for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Robin's Resonant Echo
entries: You tap into unused branching timelines to create an echo copy of yourself that has the ability to cast one spell that you have prepared before vanishing. The spell level of the spell cast by the echo must be lower than the level of the spell slot used to cast the echo. If the echo casts a spell that requires concentration, you maintain concentration on that spell when the echo disappears. If you were already concentrating on a spell, choose which spell you will maintain concentration on, and which spell will dissapate.

The echo has hit points equal to half your hit point maximum (rounded up), and you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the echo up to 30 feet in any direction. The echo cannot go through enemies nor can it pass through walls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, another echo is created for each slot above 4th. However, any duplicate other than the first cannot cast spells. You can however, when using a bonus action to move a duplicate, move all of the duplicates at once, each in a separate direction.

spell.name: Robin's Resourceful Rescue

time.condition: which you take when an ally you can see within 60 feet of you gets hit by an attack or after it is subject to a dexterity saving throw

m.text: a small wooden statuette of a Balor

entries: Whenever you cast this spell, you instantly teleport up to 60 feet to the triggering target. Once the attack or save is resolved, if the creature is willing, you can choose to teleport again, up to 60 feet to any unoccupied space you can see, taking them with you.
When you teleport for the final time, the target reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of willing creatures you can take with you increases by 1 for every slot level above 3rd. Whenever you teleport to another creature, the target must be within 30 feet of each other.
If you take multiple creatures, they all reappear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of you or in the nearest unoccupied space if all those spaces are occupied.

spell.name: Ruskar's Annihilate
entries: This spell unleashes magic that rips the souls from living creatures you can see within range.

Each creature in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, taking {@dice 25d12 + 30} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.

If a creature fails its saving throw and is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell, it instantly dies, and it's soul is completely torn asunder, and it can't be ressurected, not even by means of a {@spell wish} spell.

spell.name: Transfer Enchantment

time.condition: per rarity level of the transferring item

components.m: The magical items used in the transferring and an enchanted Lumenstone worth at least 100gp, the enchantment of which is consumed

entries: You transfer the magical qualities (properties, powers, and attack and/or bonus) of an enchanted item into another object. The receiving item must occupy the same magic item slot and be the same type as the original item. The enchantment to be moved must be valid for the receiving item, so that you cannot transfer ranged weapon properties to melee weapons, cloth-only armor properties to chainmail, and so on.

You can transfer an enchantment to an item that already contains an enchantment, but the receiving item must be of a rarity lower than the transferring item, and the receiving item’s previous magic is lost. Additionally, if you cast this spell in an attempt to transfer an Artifact or Vestiges' power, it simply fails.

spell.name: Trickster's Gyves
entries: Heavy immovable translucent chains of force-like energy, firmly tied to the body, hold the target in place. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} force damage and become {@condition restrained} and knocked {@condition prone} until the spell ends, and it can't move or be moved by any means until then. If it succeeds, it takes half damage and isn't {@condition restrained} and knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 4d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wristpocket
entries: You flick your wrist with a flourish, causing a single object in your hand to vanish.

The object, which only you can be holding and weighs no more than 5 pounds, is actually transported and stored within a small extradimensional space. The object remains there indefinitely until this cantrip is cast again, until you fall unconscious or die, upon which it is immediately transported back into your grasp, or in your space at your feet if you fall unconscious or die. You cannot store an object while one already occupies the extradimensional pocket.

spell.name: Zegarowyzs' Hastened Rest

m.text: a candle lit when you cast this spell and blown out when you finish your rest

entries: In need for a quicker rest, you ritualistically allow yourself and others to bear a student's dream; sleep longer, faster.

You and up to 4 willing creatures within range experience time dilation. Whenever you cast this spell, while taking a long or short rest, time passes twice as long in your minds, letting you take a rest by spending only half of the required time resting. This spell can be used to take both a short or long rest quicker.

{@note If you cast this spell before a long  or short rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours (or 30 minutes, in the case of a short rest). You otherwise obey all the rules for a long or short rest; only the duration is changed. Thus, creatures with the Trance feature only require 2 hours of sleep instead of 4.}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number of creatures you can affect increase by 1 for every spell slot above 4th.

subclass.name: Oath of the Open Sea
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Open Sea|Paladin||Open Sea|ArcaneWhispers|3

subclassFeature.name: Chronurgy Magic
entries: Focusing on the manipulation of time, those who follow the Chronurgy tradition learn to alter the pace of reality to their liking. Using the ramping of anticipatory divination magic, these mages can bend the flow of time as adroitly as a skilled musician plays an instrument, lending themselves and their allies an advantage in the blink of an eye.

subclassFeature.name: Relativity Savant
entries: {@i 2nd-level Chronurgy Magic feature}
Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the time you must spend to copy any spell into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Chronal Shift
entries: {@i 2nd-level Chronurgy Magic feature}

You can magically exert limited control over the flow of time around a creature. As a reaction, after you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can force the creature to reroll. You make this decision after you see whether the roll succeeds or fails. The target must use the result of the second roll.
You can use this ability twice, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: {@i 2nd-level Chronurgy Magic feature}
You can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Momentary Stasis
entries: {@i 6th-level Chronurgy Magic feature}

As an action, you can magically force a Large or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. Unless the saving throw is a success, the creature is encased in a field of magical energy until the end of your next turn or until the creature takes any damage. While encased in this way, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Abeyance
entries: {@i 10th-level Chronurgy Magic feature}

When you cast a spell using a spell slot of 4th level or lower, you can condense the spell's magic into a mote. The spell is frozen in time at the moment of casting and held within a gray bead for 1 hour. This bead is a Tiny object with AC 15 and 1 hit point, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage. When the duration ends, or if the bead is destroyed, it vanishes in a flash of light, and the spell is lost.

A creature holding the bead can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the bead disappears. The spell uses your spell attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.
Once you create a bead with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Portent
entries: {@i 14th-level Chronurgy Magic feature}

Starting at 14th level, glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness, and with it, the secrets to manipulate them. When you finish a long rest, roll three {@dice d20}s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You can choose to do so before or after the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: The Hexblade
entries: You have made a pact with a mysterious entity. This entity, whatever it may be, has granted you—or sometimes even is—a weapon carved from the boon that a Hexblade calls their pact. While unknown to many, Hexblades come in many a form. Some gain their power from the stuff of shadow, while others have made a pact with the blade itself.

The mighty sword {@i Dawnbreaker} is the most notable Hexblade weapon, which has been spread across the world over the ages, carried by a Warlock said to have made a pact with the goddess {@deity Sarenrae|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers} herself. Sages believe that almost every being with sufficient power could create a pact blade and give it to their followers, yet this brings into question what (or perhaps whom) binds these pacts in the first place.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Hexblade lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Hex Warrior
entries: At 1st level, you acquire the training necessary to effectively arm yourself for battle. You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

The influence of your patron also allows you to mystically channel your will through a particular weapon. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the two-handed property. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest. If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, this benefit extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, no matter the weapon's type.

subclassFeature.name: Hexblade's Curse
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to place a baleful curse on someone. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, you die, or you are {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.
If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

entries: You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spellsword
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: At 10th level, your hex grows more powerful. If the target cursed by your Hexblade's Curse hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses you, regardless of its roll.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Hexes
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can spread your Hexblade's Curse from a slain creature to another creature. When the creature cursed by your Hexblade's Curse dies, you can apply the curse to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of you, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated}. When you apply the curse in this way, you don't regain hit points from the death of the previously cursed creature.

subclassFeature.name: Trickery Domain (Revised)
entries: The Gods of trickery—whether they are goodwilled such as {@deity Avandra|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers} and {@deity Sehanine|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers} or ill-meaning such as {@deity Tharizdun|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers}, {@deity Tiamat|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers} and {@deity Zehir|Ilúvë|ArcaneWhispers}—are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. They're patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels and liberators. Their clerics are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, freeing captives, and flouting hollow traditions. They prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception, and theft rather than direct confrontation.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Trickster
entries: Starting when you choose this domain at 1st level, you can use your action to touch yourself or one willing creature to give it advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill stealth} skill and {@item thieves' tools}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to create an illusory duplicate of yourself.

As an action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you.

For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, whenever you are within 5 feet of your illusion, enemies have disadvantage on melee attack rolls against you, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to vanish.

As an reaction to taking damage, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to turn {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn. You remain invisible until you attack, make a damage roll or force someone to make a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Strike
entries: {@i 8th-level cleric {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Potent Spellcasting feature}

In battle, you are blessed with divine might. When a creature takes damage from one of your spells or weapon attacks, you can also deal {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Duplicity
entries: At 17th level, you can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of them up to 30 feet, to a maximum range of 120 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Time
entries: The Chroniclers is among the oldest groups of Ilúvë, dedicated to recovering ancient accounts, as well as recording current events, which they call the 'Old Ways' or 'Elder Way'. Originally established as a group of inquisitive scribes and scholars, the Chroniclers have since been branded as conspirators and have gone into hiding. It is said they make their home on the Isle of Mystar, a strange magical island near the Gnomish Archipelago of The Isles.

Even though the Chronicles are thus extremely reclusive, members of the Order can usually be recognized by their distinctive clothing, from which they get the nickname 'grey cloaks' (though apparently, their garments are now of a pale yellow color). The Chroniclers are governed by a body known as the Council of Artaeum. The Council is led by a single scholar who can hold various titles, including Ritemaster and Loremaster.

It is widely know that The Red Tower, and, by proxy, The Unsorcerors, were created as a catalyst of the Chroniclers' disappearance, and had begun to develop in 2E 230, started by the right hand of the then-Loremaster, Archivist Dendur Bran.

The Chroniclers, to most unknown, also created a small off-shoot of their order, the "Hand of Eon's Minute". This order has, since the Chroniclers have gone into hiding, reinstated itself in Thalor Ancalen, near the Cloakwood Forest. The monks of this monastic order teach a modified "Elder Way", wherein they believe and teach that Ki energy is the vital way to unlocking the secrets of time.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Timestopper
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Time feature}

Beginning at 3rd level when choosing this tradition, immidiately after you use your unarmed strike, you can choose to move up to 10 feet away without expending any movement, as you momentarily stop time. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity.
You can use this ability twice, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Speech of Importance
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of Time feature}
Starting at 6th level, you gain the ability to discreetly talk to others, by stopping time for a brief moment.

As an action, you can communicate with any number of creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, time stops for everyone except for you and the creature you are talking to. You and the creature must be able to understand eachother, and the creature must be able to speak at least one language.

To speak in this way, it requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Whenever you do this, you and the creature cannot move, make attack rolls, cast spells or take any other actions beside talking. If the creature you want to talk to is unwilling to talk to you or is actively fighting you, this ability fails for them.
When you reach 13th level, and you can speak to them regardless of whether you share a language.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Deliberated Clairvoyance
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of Time feature}
Starting at 11th level, the insight you have gained from the Order grants you vision of the spiritual world.
You can see into the ethereal plane out of a range of 30 feet, and can cast the {@spell detect magic} and {@spell identify} spells once per long rest each.
In addition, you gain darkvision out to a range of 30 feet, or increase it by 30 if you already have darkvision.

subclassFeature.name: Channeled Dilation
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of Time feature}
Starting at 17th level, you gain the ability to step backwards or forwards in time, gaining special benefits for each.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend two ki points and jump backwards in time, regaining hit points equal to 1d6 + your wisdom modifier, and appearing 30 feet in any direction you can see.
Alternatively, as a bonus action on your turn, you can expend two ki points to jump forwards in time, gaining resistance to force damage until the end of your next turn, and 30 feet extra movement.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Open Sea
entries: The Oath of the Open Sea calls to sea-faring warriors, swashbuckling sailors, and journeying guardians who seek the thrill of an endless horizon. Driven to seek the adventure and mystery across and beneath every endless oceanic expanse, paladins who swear this oath stand against those who would deny the liberties afforded to likeminded travelers, rooting out the tyrannical and corrupt that claim any shore. Such guardians believe in the natural beauty of the sea, often making offerings and prayers to entities or deities like the Wild Mother or Storm Lord that influence safe passage, while often feeling called to hunt those monstrosities that seek to terrorize and spoil the waters with wanton violence and ill intent.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Open Sea|Paladin||Open Sea|ArcaneWhispers|3
Channel Divinity: Fury of the Tides|Paladin||Open Sea|ArcaneWhispers|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Open Sea
entries: The tenets of the Oath of the Open Sea vary by paladin, but all the tenets revolve around being on the open sea, and protecting the waters of the world. Paladins who uphold these tenets often bind themselves to protecting the seas and wayfinding, making allies along the ever-treacherous way. The core principles of the tenets are in simple sailor's terms.

entries.name: No Greater Life than a Life Lived Free
entries: One should be free to chart their own path without oppression. Those who would exert their power to dominate others shall be smote.

entries.name: Trust the Skies
entries: The guidance of a strong breeze. The rumbling warnings of a coming storm. Nature is a source of portent and council that should be heeded.

entries.name: Adapt like the Water
entries: The waters of the ocean can shift around any obstacle or become an impassable one. They can carve around and reveal the secrets of the past or swallow the truth and hide it forever. To embrace this fluidity is to be ready for any challenge.

entries.name: Explore the Uncharted
entries: The world is filled with much mystery. Through the pursuit of these enigmatic ends, one can both uncover those who hide their dark deeds in shadow to be judged, and find the path to becoming something great.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Vengeance Spells
rows: {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell expeditious retreat}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Marine Layer
entries: As an action you can channel the sea to create a thick cloud of fog that surrounds you and heavily obscures the area for 20 feet in all directions, following you as you move. You and all creatures within 5 feet of you instead treat this fog as lightly obscured. This fog lasts for 10 minutes, spreads around corners and cannot be dispersed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Fury of the Tides
entries: As a bonus action, you can channel the powerful might of the waves to bolster your attacks for 1 minute. Once per turn for the duration, when you hit a creature with weapon attack, you can choose to push the target 10 feet away from you. If the target is pushed into an obstacle or another creature, they take additional bludgeoning damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Liberation
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emanate an aura while you’re not {@condition incapacitated}. You and any creature of your choice within 10 feet of you cannot be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, as well as ignore penalties on movement or attacks while underwater. Creatures that are already {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} when they enter the aura can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape nonmagical restraints.
When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of the aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Stormy Waters
entries: At 15th level, you can call crashing waters around you as a reaction whenever a creature enters or exits your melee range. The creature takes {@dice 1d12} bludgeoning damage and must succeed a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Mythic Swashbuckler
entries: At 20th level, you learn to channel the spirits of historic sea captains to briefly become a paragon of heroic adventure. As an action, you embrace these spirits of the sea, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Climbing costs no additional movement, and you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.
If you are within 5 feet of a creature, and no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, you have advantage on your attacks against that creature.
You can take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action.
You have advantage on all Dexterity ability checks and Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Deviant
entries: The Deviant Warlock is a Warlock that specializes in the art of Trickery and Deception. They might have secret identities or other such spells to mask their identities, and are notorious for wreaking havoc wherever they may pass.

Your patron is a deity of a Trickery domain; ideally Asmodeus or other Betrayer Gods, or the vicious aspects of Sehanine. Any devil might do too, such as a Succubus, Rakshasa (These work very well) or some other Tricksy Fiend.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Deviant lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn the {@spell friends} and {@spell minor illusion} cantrips. They don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Crown of Lies
entries: Also starting at 1st level, when you cast Friends, you can choose whether the creature realizes you used magic to influence its mood or not.
In addition, when you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check to have someone believe something you say, treat a roll of 7 or lower on the d20 as an 8.

subclassFeature.name: Sudden Duplicity
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell mirror image} once without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Facsimile
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can create an illusionary duplicate of yourself at will. Unlike other illusionary duplicates, it seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to yourself.
While not in combat, the illusionary duplicate can perform simple tasks such as standing watch, relaying a message, performing an act, and aiding another creature verbally.
The illusionary duplicate will remain until you use this feature again, dismiss it, or if you are more than 120 feet away from it.

subclassFeature.name: Malefic Illusions
entries: Starting at 14th level, your illusionary duplicates can deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.
When an illusionary duplicate mimics a weapon attack it deals {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma modifier in psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: The Grifter
entries: The Grifter (A Trickster Alternative), a powerful being said to have originated when the Feywild and the Shadowfell were being split from Ilúvë, is an agent of chaos. Warlocks of this patron have are few and far between, but they all share the same unnatural luck and penchant for chaos as their benefactor.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Grifter lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Satirical Sorcery
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn the {@spell vicious mockery} and {@spell guidance} cantrips. They are warlock cantrips for you, and they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Uncanny Luck
entries: Also at 1st level, your penchant for chaos has attracted the intrigue of your benefactor. Once per long rest, you can choose for an attack to do one more die worth of damage. You can only use this feature on weapons or spells that target a single target, with a single damage die.
The number of times you can use this feature increases to twice at 6th level, three times at 10th level, four times at 14th level, and five times at 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: Subtle Speech
entries: Starting at 6th level, your patron has taught you the ways of speaking without saying anything. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} skills; if you already have proficiency in either of these skills, you add double your proficiency bonus to said skill. Additionally, you learn the {@spell Friends} cantrip and can cast the {@spell Charm Person} spell a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) without material components. You regain all uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Mind
entries: Starting at 10th level, your patron's ways have influenced your own.
If you're not already, you become a chaotic alignment. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.
In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made to hide information about your alignment, your patron and your backstory.

subclassFeature.name: Echoes of the Prime
entries: Starting at 14th level, your luck is far greater than any mortal odds. Once per long rest, you can choose for a successful attack to become a critical hit.
The number of times you can use this feature increases to twice at 17th level, and three times at 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: The Trickster
entries: The Trickster, a powerful being said to have originated when the Feywild and the Shadowfell were being split from Ilúvë, is an agent of chaos. Warlocks of this patron have are few and far between, but they all share the same unnatural luck and penchant for chaos as their benefactor.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Trickster lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Satirical Sorcery
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn the {@spell vicious mockery} and {@spell guidance} cantrips. They are warlock cantrips for you, and they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Uncanny Luck
entries: Also at 1st level, your penchant for chaos has attracted the intrigue of your benefactor. Once per long rest, you can choose for an attack to do one more die worth of damage. You can only use this feature on weapons or spells that target a single target, with a single damage die.
The number of times you can use this feature increases to twice at 6th level, three times at 10th level, four times at 14th level, and five times at 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell mirror image} once without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. In addition, you learn the {@spell friends} cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips you know, and when you cast it, you can choose whether the creature realizes you used magic to influence its mood or not.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Mind
entries: Starting at 10th level, your patron's ways have influenced your own.
If you're not already, you become a chaotic alignment. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.
In addition, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made to hide information about your alignment, your patron and your backstory.

subclassFeature.name: Echoes of the Prime
entries: Starting at 14th level, your luck is far greater than any mortal odds. Once per long rest, you can choose for a successful attack to become a critical hit.
The number of times you can use this feature increases to twice at 17th level, and three times at 20th level.

languages.name: Arconic
entries: Arconic, a language spoken by the ancient and long-forgotten mages of Arcanix, is a dead tongue. Very few creatures in the world today would recognize it, much less speak it. Arconic used the Draconic alphabet in its written form, while the spoken language had many similarities with Sylvan, due to the Arcanixian mages being almost wholly comprised of Eladrin and High-Elves. A character who speaks Sylvan can understand what a creature speaking Arconic is saying, and vice versa. A character who has the {@background Cloistered Scholar|PHB} or {@background Sage|PHB} background, or a {@class warlock} who knows the {@optfeature Eyes of the Rune Keeper} invocation, can translate written Arconic without an ability check.
